subtask.title: Analyze Automation Scenarios for AI Agents
subtask.objective: Identify automation tasks where AI agents outperform sequential prompts based on theoretical principles.
subtask.scope: Evaluate tasks requiring adaptability, real-time decision-making, and dynamic environments.

verification.completion_summary: The research identified key differences between AI agents and sequential prompts, with focus on automation scenarios requiring adaptability and real-time decision-making. However, theoretical principles underlying AI superiority were not systematically analyzed.

covered_aspects: Definition of AI agents vs sequential prompts
Comparison of adaptability in dynamic environments
Examples of automation scenarios (logistics, fraud detection)
General advantages of AI agents in non-linear tasks
missing_aspects: Systematic theoretical analysis of why AI outperforms
Detailed case studies demonstrating theoretical frameworks

missing_requirements: Theoretical framework analysis (e.g., machine learning theory, decision theory)
Quantitative comparisons between AI agents and sequential prompts
Detailed technical explanations of adaptability mechanisms
